name: RemoveServiceDependency
description:
Disassociate dependencies between two services.

Use this tool to disassociate or remove dependencies between two business or technical services in PagerDuty. Suitable for scenarios where you need to update or modify service relationships managed by different teams.

parameters.name: version_header
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to use via the `Accept` header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: The content type of the request, must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: service_relationships_to_remove
parameters.description: JSON array detailing service pairs where dependencies need to be removed. Each pair includes 'supporting_service' and 'dependent_service' with 'id' and 'type'.

supporting_service.description: The reference to the service that supports the dependent service.

dependent_service.description: The reference to the service that is dependent on the supporting service.

relationships.description: List of all service dependencies to be deleted.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

supporting_service.description: The reference to the service that supports the dependent service.

dependent_service.description: The reference to the service that is dependent on the supporting service.

relationships.description: List of all service dependencies to be deleted.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
